root: ^You enter this room only to take a step back. A huge floating eyeball waits in the center of the room. It is as wide as you are tall. The eye's sickly green iris contracts as it stares at you.

c-0: ^ rug over the eye. It still looks creepy hanging there but you should be free to walk past it now.

returning: ^You return to the room with the floating eye.

b: ^ rug still hangs over it. You notice it twitch left and right to follow the noise of your footfalls but fortunately you can't make eye contact.

s0: ^At first you only see its slick veined white behind. Then it slowly rotates to regard you again.
s1: ^You blink several times, as if to gain an advantage by doing something it can't.

s0: ^You're not going to get past it unless you find something to cover it.
s1: ^A rug would come in handy right now.

stiff: ^You take a step forwards. The floating eye's pupil dilates, its iris a glowing ring around a chasm. Your limbs stiffen until you can barely move. You are paralysed.

c-0: ^Minutes pass. With great effort you are able to blink and save your own eyes from drying out.
^Only straining towards a retreat allows you to free yourself. You stagger backwards from the floating eye, finally free from its grasp. You'll need to
^cover the eye if you're going to get past it. A decent sized rug would do the trick.
